Conduct a comprehensive cost audit to identify areas of inefficiency within production lines that can lead directly to reducing costs by at least 5% annually without compromising quality or worker well-being, and implement these findings immediately into the operational workflows starting Q2 Year 1 using lean manufacturing principles.
   
2. Initiate a pilot program in one of Brandix's smaller production units to fully automate repetitive tasks with AI technology by mid-Year 1; this will serve as an R&D hub for innovation, reducing manual labor costs and improving speed without sacrificing craftsmanship quality standards.
   
3. Develop a skills enhancement program specifically tailored towards upskilling the workforce in areas of energy management and resource optimization to reduce wasteful practices identified from audit findings; this will include hands-on training, eLearning modules on best practices for material usage by Q2 Year 1.

a) Achieve a target of reducing energy consumption in production lines by at least 7% within the first year, measured against baseline data from the previous fiscal quarter ending March Year 1. Use smart meters and IoT devices to continuously monitor usage patterns with real-time analytics for adjustments.
   
b) Reduce material waste per unit produced (including fabric scraps, excess dyes, etc.) by at least 5% in the first year, measured quarterly from Q2 Year 1 onwards using RFID tagging and inventory management systems to track resource flow accurately within production.
   
c) Maintain a defect rate below the target of <0.01%, with an aim for continuous improvement; monitor this KPI monthly through integrated quality control software that reports directly into Brandix's ERP system, facilitating quick response to any deviations in real-time.
